website_summaries.verdict: A mechanical keyboard that is more affordable than other models and is a favorite of many gamers.
pros: Features a red backlight, 2 USB 2.0 ports, and a matte finish
The keys are comfortable to use, with a slight texture to the space bar, and aren't as loud as other mechanical keyboards
cons: The keys are very sensitive, so it's easy to type when you don't mean to

customer_reviews.title: Good, solid build with weird flaws.
customer_reviews.text: I like the look, feel and build of this keyboard. However, there is something that is either an error in manufacturing or just Corsairs quirky way of doing things. Keys like the number keys, apostrophe/quote, question mark etc have the shifted symbol listed UNDER the unshifted one. For instance, the quote symbol is printed under the apostrophe on the key. Not a deal breaker but not what I expect when I spend $110 on a keyboard. Also, the fact that they listed this keyboard as "quiet" is a bit of a stretch but I like a chunky mechanical keyboard. If you, however, are looking for a quiet one, look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Great keyboard besides the price
customer_reviews.text: I decided to pay the extra $30 for the MK.2 because it had a volume scroll wheel which works great to control the volume when doing anything, but if you can not spend the extra money do not hesitate and instead get the MK.1. The Keyboard feels great, now I can type at night without having to struggle it also helps when doing homework and when gaming. My only complaint is not from the keyboard but how Amazon decided to package the keyboard. Amazon shipped the keyboard only with the keyboard box and as a result, a few keys were loose. If I'm paying over $120, I'd expect better packaging from Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Rogue

customer_reviews.title: Makes too many extraa characters.
customer_reviews.text: This review is about :It really saddens me to write this review since I have been a Corsair fanboy for many years. This is absolutely the worse keyboard I haave ever owned in my 30 years of computer use. It continuallly inserts extraa characters into your typed text, as you can well see in this review. "A's" and "L's" are particularly troublesome. I would not buy aagain and certainly would not recommend to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Mel

customer_reviews.title: Terrible product
customer_reviews.text: My first one died literally days after buying it. So after contacting Corsair, the best option was a replacement. That worked fine and dandy... for a couple months. Now the replacement is as dead as the first. Corsair customer support is of no help and takes days to respond. Even a phone call does little to help. So I'm done. I've let them know that I will send the keyboard to them personally and see if they can fix it. If not, I want another replacement. Til then, one star. Avoid this keyboard, and other Corsair products like the plague.
customer_reviews.author: Etienne Perry Noel Jones Austin

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful keyboard
customer_reviews.text: My son likes to game Vietnam and WW2 shooters. It took him awhile to adjust from his Alienware gaming Laptop keyboard to this keyboard which has a definite key height difference. This keyboard has a lot of controls and lighting which I'm sure my son hasn't even begun to scratch the surface. Cable is very sturdy, shrouded and has 2 connectors. The only problem I have is the keys can pop off fairly easily. It does come with extra keys just in case some get lost. Also comes with a hard plastic wrist rest that snaps to the front of the keyboard. My son hasn't used it.
customer_reviews.author: Castle Doe

customer_reviews.title: Good Keyboard
customer_reviews.text: Best keyboard I've had so far, although it's also the second keyboard I've had. The RGB lighting really helps the look of my game room. The software (iCue) that Corsair has now for all of their devices is super easy to use, but I only wish they had integration of the Hue smart lights I have in my game room. Other than that this keyboard, so far, has been worth the $100 I've spent. P.S. even though corsair shows their special character keys in upside down, they do not actually work upside down. i.e. you still have to hold down shift to do a question mark and no shift still does forward slash.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Riley Kennedy

customer_reviews.title: Not as loud as it could be, but still loud
customer_reviews.text: I really need the quietest possible mechanical keyboard (i need a quiet keyboard, I want a mechanical keyboard) so I picked this one up, but, it isn't really that quiet. The clicking noise it does make is much more pleasant than the typical keyboard. The keys are so smooth I don't care about the noise. My coworkers though? That's another story.
customer_reviews.author: Jess B

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for use in our company's open office environment and it's been an absolute slam dunk! The feel of the keyboard when typing is excellent, and it really is INCREDIBLY quite for a mechanical keyboard, even more so than the membrane keyboards most others use in the office. Already had one other person in the office buy one himself after trying it out (he loves it as well), and the RGB gets constant compliments. If you're looking for a solid mechanical keyboard to use in an office - or within earshot of a sensitive housemate - this is the one you want to go with.
customer_reviews.author: JW

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy it. Key caps are garbage
customer_reviews.text: When I received this in the mail, there were 10+ keys flying in the packaging, and I thought the keycaps were oddly loose. A month later, keys started to snap and I noticed all the loose key caps were already broken in some way and the other ones are super fragile. For a keyboard that costs this much, this shouldn't happen. I have bought cheap mechanical keyboards and they have better key caps for much less. As of writing this, 92 keys are cracked, and I'm sure they were received this way. I take care of my electronics and there is no way that I damaged these keys from typing, gaming, and coding.
customer_reviews.author: Adam Corpstein

customer_reviews.title: Buggy and frustrating
customer_reviews.text: I was very excited when I first got the keyboard but within a day I was experiencing problems. The keyboard would start typing multiple letters even when I wasn't pressing anything on it. (Like entering D forever) and it would randomly stop working once an hour. (This is especially frustrating when you're playing games online). I worked with corsair and tried all the trouble shooting steps and was still experiencing problems. It was a shame because it is a decent keyboard otherwise.
customer_reviews.author: omair malik

customer_reviews.title: Decent
customer_reviews.text: Besides the USB cord being obtrusively huge It's decent. I've never seen a thicker usb cable just for usb 2.0 pass through. The keys are wobbly compared to other mechanical keyboards I've tried. It does have a a metal frame, in case I wanted to beat someone with it. I wouldn't say the price is fair, just because of the supposed hype around mechanical keyboards has driven price to stupid levels, but that's business. Description: red back lit mechanical keyboard, no extra frills about it. All the keys are the same as any keyboard. I have tried all of the Cherry MX switch colors, and the red switch type was the one I tended to like the best.
customer_reviews.author: RTegland

customer_reviews.title: i've had better for cheaper
customer_reviews.text: the keyboard is fine...red isn't my fave for backlighting, but oh well. It is not NEARLY as quiet as I had hoped. I game, so i like backlight...but i also work with my keyboard, and wanted a quiet board for when i'm taking notes while talking on the phone with customers. this keyboard is not even a little quiet...even if you only tap the keys (it's pretty sensitive so you can tap them lightly), it's still pretty loud, but not in the normal mechanical keyboard sort of way...it's...like a swish sound. i'll keep the board until it wears out, but i wouldn't buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa S

customer_reviews.title: More Style than Substance...
customer_reviews.text: Nice heavy keyboard with fast positive key strokes BUT... the over-stylized letters {short and fat} actually make those letters harder to see than if they had just left them alone. There is NO written material with this board, none! No manual or guide. But the thing that's making me send this back is awkward/ineffective music controls! No separate 4-key area for controlling my Spotify, and the "music" keys that have been combined with number keys simply do NOT work!
customer_reviews.author: F. Mallory

customer_reviews.title: Good, but....
customer_reviews.text: This keyboard worked great for some time, maybe 5-6 months. I had absolutely no issues at all with, until eventually my zero key on the numpad started acting up, it would always either double press or not press at all with a keystroke. And now it literally doesn't work at all. I've tried literally everything and it just won't budge. Really is a shame. My keyboard is probably just faulty. But i would definitely recommend to everyone to get this keyboard, assuming this malfunction won't happen. Its the best I have used but it stinks that it is out of warranty :( I use ALL corsair products for my peripherals but may rethink. Just my story though.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good keyboard, really bad software.
customer_reviews.text: Good keyboard, really bad software. Update: Got so tired of this keyboard's bad software and clunky options, I bought a Logitech G610. Instantly realize so many things that are wrong with this keyboard. It's way bigger than it needs to be, has only one Windows key, poor selection of hardware buttons. It was my first mechanical keyboard so I thought it was better than it was. Mechanical is indeed the way to go, but choose a different keyboard. As I alluded to originally, the keyboard itself isn't so bad though it could be better, but the software is just abominable. Unstable, inscrutable, and surprisingly limited.
customer_reviews.author: BK

customer_reviews.title: Perfect and beautiful, a joy to use.
customer_reviews.text: This is the best keyboard I've ever owned, my previous one being a Razer Black Widow. The mechanical keys feel wonderful and are absolutely precise, however they're not super loud and clackity like many others. There are no unecessary keys (I didn't want macro keys or media controls) and the textured WASD keys are perfect for staying oriented. Another aspect I really appreciate is the shift functions are also backlit and clearly readable. My ONLY gripe is that the feet have no nonskid coating on them.
customer_reviews.author: Bryce Calderwood

customer_reviews.title: Came in a broken box, some LEDs not working
customer_reviews.text: The product came inside a box that was severely broken and torn, with no further external packaging. May be a previously returned product that was not handled correctly. The left ctrl key had popped off when I opened the box, and had to be reattached. I tried out the keyboard and while the keys worked, the three LEDs at the top (caps lock, num lock, scroll lock) did not light up when the corresponding keys were pressed. I have returned it for an exchange, and hopefully the replacement keyboard will actually be NEW.
customer_reviews.author: Janet

customer_reviews.title: Their customer service was terrible, ended up just returning for full refund through ...
customer_reviews.text: Just bought the keyboard, did not work correctly. Their customer service was terrible, ended up just returning for full refund through amazon. Will not buy Corsair products again after this experience.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Witt

customer_reviews.title: Amazing for the price. Minimum draw backs.
customer_reviews.text: Great keyboard for the price. Keys are not to loud and the cherry switches are great. Could use a better angle and possible a bigger wrist rest, but thats just nit picky. The icue software has a learning curve, but u and do whatever u want to this keyboard after you get the swing of it.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly

customer_reviews.title: High Quality
customer_reviews.text: This is a great mechanical keyboard! All keys are very high quality and very easy to replace with the different included keys. I would not recommend this for long typing (like papers), for the keys have a pretty far travel distance but it is great for gaming and everyday use. The included software works great to control lighting and programming (only red though not rgb). The USB pass-through is also very well built and great quality. Very nice keyboard!
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Stokes

customer_reviews.title: Terrible Product, Broke in a matter of Months.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this in January, It lasted until the end of July. Terrible Product, All my F keys stopped working, Num Lock and Scroll Lock Stopped Working. Never spilled anything on it. Just one day decided to crap out. Updated drivers,firmware, changed usb slots. Nothing fixed it. Pretty short shelf life for a 70 dollar keyboard. I will never buy another corsair product again.
customer_reviews.author: Len

customer_reviews.title: get some o rings for keys
customer_reviews.text: they will soften the sounds of the keys smacking down with this keyboard. The cherry switch is silent, the clacking of the keys as you press them all the way down is not. The keyboard is great though. Very responsive and I love the textured keys that come with. (u get textured wasd keys and a few other letters that i forgot.)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: nice keyboard, feels solid. well lit.
customer_reviews.text: great keyboard. feels sturdy and solid. way better than the crappy backlit one had previously. one point off for not being able to go to their website to download the software for it. my browser gave a strange warning about going to the website and something about the formatting of the web page. still, the basic features are all i wanted anyway, extra software running in the background wasn't something I really wanted anyway. so it was win-win either way.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Conti

customer_reviews.title: Great built quality
customer_reviews.text: By far the best keyboard iv ever had. It comes with a tool to pop of the key caps real easily for cleaning or replacement. The icue software is amazing! You can make any color combination imaginable. It feels great and is smooth.
customer_reviews.author: Raghav sharma

customer_reviews.title: Great budget keyboard
customer_reviews.text: Great entry level gaming keyboard. I’ve been pc gaming for many years and this keyboard is great. It has all the must haves (audio controls, window keys lock, wheel volume control, textured/curved swappable WASD keys, and palm rest. Keyboard is excellent in terms of lighting and feel. The only drawback is it is an all plastic design. The individual lighting and software is amazing for the price point. Very satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: jeremy

customer_reviews.title: A+ Easily only of the best mech keyboards available.
customer_reviews.text: Easily one of, if not the best mechanical keyboard out there. Cherry red switches feel phenomenal, the build quality is top notch, and the RGB is a great touch. The iCUE software is very much improved since it's release also! Keyboard came with a handful of extra textured caps, WASDQE and a tool to easily remove them. Was a great addition as I have a lot of keybindings for those, plus alt/shift modifiers. Makes it very easy to never miss a key again in a pressure situation where you could be spamming keys on reaction.
customer_reviews.author: Marshall

customer_reviews.title: BUY IT!
customer_reviews.text: Love this keyboard. First time I've invested in a keyboard I didn't get with my PC and im very good I did. The feel when using this keyboard is great. The color is beautiful, I've gotten alot of compliments. I feel like I type alot better on this as well as it increasing my response time when gaming. If you're looking for something new, give this a shot!
customer_reviews.author: MikeyT6633

customer_reviews.title: Keycaps loose
customer_reviews.text: i recently bought a keyboard corsair strafe MK.2..then i realize that ESC button (keycaps) are easily remove or its loose.. then i check all the keycaps and found out that some of them are the same as the ESC.. which ive been rarely use like F1, F4, F5 and 0 button.. material quality is good but and also the durability but i think i got a faulty device..that's it
customer_reviews.author: Mark Gil U. Del Pilar

customer_reviews.title: Durable, Super Cl-icky Keys, Fast reaction, great for gaming
customer_reviews.text: What can I say... I love it.. Cherry MX switches, Super clicky as the should be, very sensitive! Bought one for me for gaming and one for my daughter for her gaming setup and even got one for my wife for her work computer. Keys are supper sensitive, and makes her typing much smoother with the switch sensitivity and the RGB works great for all of our ADD problems, LOL.. really nice setup for the money.
customer_reviews.author: pTsDaD Workshop

customer_reviews.title: Big disappointment
customer_reviews.text: Keyboard has nice heavy duty feel to it but the keys sit twice as high as a normal keyboard and are very loud. The keys have a rough feel when pressed not the soft gentle feel of my previous keyboard (Logitech K700). Nice back lighting. Debating whether to return or live with my mistake.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Serious gaming keyboard.
customer_reviews.text: This keyboard is amazing. Used it for Overwatch and Gears of War 4. Excellent tactile feedback. The whole thing feels really solid and high quality. The extra key caps for WSAD are slightly angled and textured - really good for people who may be new to PC gaming to keep your fingers where they need to be. I spammed the heck out of the keyboard in gears while trying to get into/out of cover, and it's worked fantastically so far. Would definitely recommend this to a PC gamer.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Worked perfectly for 8 months, then needed to enable bios mode for it to continue to work
customer_reviews.text: Update 10-06-2020 Like every other corsair kb, this one has had LED lights fail This will be my last corsair KB I bought this as a gift and it worked flawlessly for almost 7 months. Then, for no reason, every time the keyboard backlight was on it would type repeat * all the time. It was not easy to find the hotkey combo for enabling bios mode, but we finally did and that resolved the issue. Not sure why it worked all this time and then started doing that
customer_reviews.author: Honkwomp

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Mechanical Keyboard with Quality
customer_reviews.text: First of all, this is my first mechanical keyboard and I love it. Packaging was awesome as usual, standart Amazon quality. I read lots of user comments and reviews before deciding to buy this one and bought Strafe Cherry Mx Red switch with Red led. Lets get directly to pros & cons, Pros : Beautiful minimalist design You can feel the quality in every single part User friendly software with beautiful custom effects. Tacticle feedback of keys & sound is really good after a hundred years of membrane keyboard usage. ( mines are cherry mx red ) Cons : Non for now.
customer_reviews.author: Omur Karaman

customer_reviews.title: Constantly lost connectivity (USB)
customer_reviews.text: Constantly lost connectivity (USB) - especially when computer coming out of sleep. I had to unplug the keyboard, and plug it back it - hit or miss - mostly miss. I ended up going with a different brand, which I've had zero issues with.
customer_reviews.author: Roberto Andrade, Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my husband and he is IN LOVE with it! Definitely worth the money. He is into mechanical keyboards and had an old one that was super noisy. He is huge into computer gaming and is always typing, so it was always loud. So, it's good for me too because I can actually study now and it's quiet! Lol. This keyboard is so awesome though, so many options to personalize it and the keys feel so nice, great for gaming with no lag.
customer_reviews.author: Danielle Carl

customer_reviews.title: great key response
customer_reviews.text: Works well, great key response, fun customization. I will say though, having only red keys doesn't really open up the possibilities for customization, as most custom presets (user made or Corsair made) are made for the full color keyboards. I chose this model because it matches the color and styling of my rig, and I didn't think I'd really use the multicolored features enough to justify the extra price of the full color models. However, if you think you will use the full-color customization, and you have a few extra bucks to spare, I'd say go for it. The build quality on these keyboards is great.
customer_reviews.author: Adrian G.

customer_reviews.title: he thinks the dual usb plugs are annoying as they take two usb ports to fully utilize ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my husband. He says that it has a really pleasant clicking sound while typing. It has well-made keys. He likes the ability to adjust the color brightness. However, he thinks the dual usb plugs are annoying as they take two usb ports to fully utilize the keyboard but says "it's not a game changer or anything" he would definitely buy again.
customer_reviews.author: RachtheRock

customer_reviews.title: After a year of use, its still working with some ignorable flaws
customer_reviews.text: The LED lighting for the caps lock key has a loose wire and stopped working a while back. I can take the key off and move the bulb slightly for it to turn back on if I really want, but I generally keep the LED off. It turns itself on though every time you start the computer. The keys also flop off pretty easily, even the unused ones.
customer_reviews.author: Shlean

customer_reviews.title: Yep, it clicks
customer_reviews.text: Solid keyboard. Cherry red switches seem a little softer than other reds I’ve used, but other than that, great keyboard. LED brightness is adjustable. Cables are fairly heavy duty, matching the quality of the board. Also, the USB pass though is an actual extension cable to extend a USB port from the PC to the back of the keyboard - not a cheap USB hub as I suspected.
customer_reviews.author: supremegalacticemperor

customer_reviews.title: This keyboard has a great black/red look that matches my build
customer_reviews.text: This keyboard has a great black/red look that matches my build. It is a high quality product! The only thing I don't like is the Corsair Utility Program needs to be on all the time for any light effects to work. It is an easy program to use. So far my favorite is the ripple lighting that waves away in every direction when a button is pushed. The rain setting is also pretty neat. The LEDs are nice and bright even on a bright sunny day and can be adjusted to different brightness levels.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, Sleek, Must-have for Gamers
customer_reviews.text: I love the mechanical keyboard style, and this keyboard from Corasir is extremely well made. It is surprisingly heavy, which proves that solid materials went into the construction of this product. I am an avid gamer and use the keyboard daily, and I just love the performance that I get out of it. Very nice red highlights in the backdrop highlighting the entire board, and each key is highlighted which provides perfect vision for either working or gaming. I'd definitely recommend this instead of a keyboard that you would have to replace in a short time - This keyboard feels like it will last at least 10 years with no issues.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: great heavy duty keyboard
customer_reviews.text: great heavy duty keyboard. I just don't like the software that controls the lights, it turns them off for you and then you have to get rid of the software for the lights to stay on, so I just run no software cause I don't tune my keyboards so it works absolutely perfect for me, I love this keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: Thebrevvv

customer_reviews.title: Reliable and clean
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this keyboard for the better part of two years. The keys function as they should (they click a lot) The lights are 100% programmable. From patterns and wave animations to solid lighting. Easy to clean (as far as keyboards do go) The only thing Is that I sometimes wish the cable was just a few inches longer.
customer_reviews.author: S.N.

customer_reviews.title: best keyboard ive owned yet!!!!
customer_reviews.text: omg what can i say this is the best gaming keyboard ive ever had. the cherry mx reds are so smooth and quiet its amazing the only thing you hear is the bump from switch bottoming out which isnt loud or annoying. the extras corsair sends also like the extra keycaps and keycap puller is just great, also i recommend installing the software because although its not rgb it still has cool led effects you can play with. only thing i wish corsair added was some stickers so i could represent but other than that still 5 stars
customer_reviews.author: Joey

customer_reviews.title: By far the best keyboard
customer_reviews.text: As computer user, this is by far the best keyboard that ever haved. Its heavy in the hand (that quality to me), the sound when you type.....loved, the leds are bright enough and good animations (great), big keys and no lags or missed key in fast writing. To resume, i loved it, every aspect its great, i only wish haved it sooner.
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin

customer_reviews.title: Tremendous Keyboard
customer_reviews.text: I game, and work from a home office, and this is excellent for both. It's a bit noisier than most mechanicals, but that might be that I type hard. Overall build quality is great, really well made. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Glenn

customer_reviews.title: Good gaming keyboard for FPS
customer_reviews.text: This is my second mechanical gaming keyboard and I love my experience with this one. I have tried brown switches before but I could not get used to them. But the responsiveness, feeling and sound of these red switches are just perfect fit for me. If you mainly play games than writing so many things, I would really recommend this one. I mainly play FPS and MMO, as a reference for your preferences.
customer_reviews.author: Yigit Cinar

customer_reviews.title: Different Strokes for Different Folks, this Keyboard is Fine by Me.
customer_reviews.text: I'm typing this review on the Corsair keyboard, and I'm here to say it's a delight. We chose the red illumination. The action of the keys is just right, each key is slightly indented which helps minimize keystroke errors, and it feels and sounds right. I use it for writing and it works well for that; my kid uses it quite a bit for gaming and seems entirely satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Ross E. Nelson

customer_reviews.title: the keyboard and switches are great, but the software sucks
customer_reviews.text: the leds turn off, it changes its profile on its own, software locks my case leds. the keyboard and switches are great, but the software sucks
customer_reviews.author: Elton Schmidt

customer_reviews.title: Great motherboard with awesome features
customer_reviews.text: Big fan of Corsair! Never lets me down! Great motherboard with awesome features. Personally using the wave mode. :) Mechanical keys are nice but I threw some 0-rings to make it a bit more silent and still the keys are very sensitive and responsive. Another plus is that the cords are breaded! Big plus for me because i hate cheapy cords that bend and break easily.
customer_reviews.author: Zachary

customer_reviews.title: Works great for actuation (the reason for having a gaming
customer_reviews.text: Works great for actuation (the reason for having a gaming, mechanical keyboard) I can easily strafe quickly & continuously in FPS games (BF4 and BF1) in comparison to my old "mechanical keyboard" Not sure if it was just my order, but my keyboard sometimes isn't connected (while it's physically connected) I boot up my PC and attempt to input my password, but the keyboard doesn't work until I disconnect and reconnect the keyboard. Not a significant issue, but annoying nonetheless.
customer_reviews.author: Yoshi8o8

customer_reviews.title: Cool keyboard. Crap software.
customer_reviews.text: If you buy this keyboard, do not make more than one profile.... software crashes often, you have to go into registry and delete everything and uninstall everything. Then reinstal. This is my second full cycle. Works for a day or two and stops again after competing the whole process
customer_reviews.author: ConcentratedBacon

customer_reviews.title: I like it having three dimming levels for the back light
customer_reviews.text: This keyboard is fast and quiet, comparing to the blue switch keyboard. I like it having three dimming levels for the back light. USB for the mouse right on the keyboard. Responsive on every click. The keys could be more curved to fit the finger tips better, but it is not a big deal. One thing I really dislike is the stiff large cord to power the keyboard. I wish it were the flexible, soft, braided cord like many other keyboards.
customer_reviews.author: Sheila T

customer_reviews.title: Not good
customer_reviews.text: Half of the keys had no spring back at all. Some keys also fell off really easy too. No way can anyone pay over $70 for defective junk. I bought a much better brand that I do like and it was a little less expensive and 10x better.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: My thoughts
customer_reviews.text: I have had this keyboard and mouse for about 2 weeks. I love it and even though it is a tad bit loud but very responsive. Changes to any color you want and pattern you want it to display as. Great buy will update if anything!
customer_reviews.author: William

customer_reviews.title: Solid performer.  Excellent feel.
customer_reviews.text: Fabulous feel. For some silly reason, they put the numbers ABOVE the symbols, and that throws me off every now and then. All in all a very solid, well built keyboard. My 16 year old son likes the programmable backlighting. I really don't care one way or another. Don't let the lights turn you off, you can setup the corsair app to turn them off when you log in. If you like blinking/waving lights then you will have fun with this device. This keyboard is FAR superior to the last "Keytronic Lifetime" keyboard I bought.
customer_reviews.author: Malcolm L. Franklin

customer_reviews.title: The Dream Keyboard for Gaming
customer_reviews.text: I play a number of FPS games, and I was looking for a reliable, high performance keyboard which wouldn't aggravate my wrist/hand RSI while I played. This product is extremely easy on the hands, and it avoids any of the issues found in lesser keyboards wherein pressing multiple keys simultaneously would not be detected. Don't be put off by the crazy LEDs if that's not your thing; they're trivially easy to disable.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Blumenkrantz

customer_reviews.title: The keys wont stay on
customer_reviews.text: The keys pop off of the keyboard during use. This is not what I would expect from a very expensive keyboard. Stay away from this keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Opened the box
customer_reviews.text: I opened the box and this is what I saw. Placed keys back on but they didn't hold very well. Also missing 'Windows' key. Going back.
customer_reviews.author: HS

customer_reviews.title: Really badly designed.
customer_reviews.text: I'm typing this review for the second time because the layout of these keys causes my palms to constantly hit the left and right ctrl buttons and I accidently deleted the first review. I type 90+ wpm and work in IT so i'm not new to keyboards. My fingers don't lay across the keyboard, they are curved and perched above the keys, ready to strike down and come back up with enough precision not to run into the other keys. I'm hoping Amazon will return this as I'm about about to start using my 9 dollar walmart keyboard again. This keyboard is quite pretty though.
customer_reviews.author: Wes Murray

customer_reviews.title: Unsurpassed durability
customer_reviews.text: This is a tough keyboard. I'm a rager. When playing games I can get pretty mad. I've put this through a lot of pain. Half of the lights don't light up anymore, but all the keys still are perfect which is a miracle, because I've smacked the keyboard so hard that keys have flown halfway across the room. Highly recommend for durability alone. Until this I've normally gone through a keyboard every couple of months.
customer_reviews.author: Nate Hanson

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Mechanical Keyboard
customer_reviews.text: This is an awesome mechanical keyboard. If you are into Red Cherry switches, this is the keyboard for you. It will only light up in red but that's okay with me. The keys are soft with very little travel before they register. They are a bit louder than the usual non mechanical keyboard but nothing that you can't live with. I highly recommend this board.
customer_reviews.author: J. BLANCO

customer_reviews.title: Great keyboard. I've been using this for about a ...
customer_reviews.text: Great keyboard. I've been using this for about a year and this performs just like the day I got it! My only issue with this keyboard is that a couple of times the keyboard will give all the signs of it bricking itself (showing as a drive labeled "CRP disabled") and then maybe 30 minutes later it will magically start working again. Its only happened to me 4-5 times since buying it, but every time it gave me great frustration and scared the living crap out of me. Redownloading drivers and the utility tool yielded no results, but again it magically started working on its own after time.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice Keyboard, not Perfect
customer_reviews.text: While it feels, and sounds, nice using this keyboard, I find the keys a little too close together for completely comfortable gaming. The grey WASD keys make the keys feel even closer as they're sloped a bit. The effects are kinda cool, being able to light up only the keys you need is great for gaming in the dark.
customer_reviews.author: Stippy

customer_reviews.title: Great keyboard and enjoy using it
customer_reviews.text: Bought keyboard for my son who wanted the mechanical keyboard for gaming. I don't know why but typing on this keyboard is very satisfying. I think it is the combo of the sound it makes and also the fast action of the keys. It is very sturdy and the red backlight is very helpful at night.
customer_reviews.author: JC

customer_reviews.title: Great hardware, OK software
customer_reviews.text: Hardware is great, software is OK - inconsistent and often runs in to issues updating. I don't use most of the software's features, so this doesn't impact me too much, but I could imagine those who use the software's more advanced features may be more perturbed when it doesn't work as expected.
customer_reviews.author: GeekDad

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't hold up.
customer_reviews.text: I've owned this keyboard for about a year now and I'm retiring it. I like the look and feel of it but after about 6 months of use some keys began to register multiple keystrokes. I contacted Corsair for support and they suggested I try some contact cleaner to clean the switches. I bought some and tried this but it had no effect. Corsair then authorized an RMA. I shipped it back and they sent me a new keyboard in retail packaging. After six months with the replacement keyboard the same multiple keystrokes issue is beginning to occur. I'm satisfied with the support Corsair offered but I'm not interested in repeating the process every six months.
customer_reviews.author: Bakes

customer_reviews.title: I love this keyboard
customer_reviews.text: I love this keyboard, it types much better than I expected. I would've got the RGB one but I only had 80 bucks, but at least I don't have to type on my horrible dell backup anymore, this is the second mechanical keyboard I've ever owned, the last one had cherry MX blue switches, this one has cherry MX red switches. and I gotta say, they feel SO MUCH better than the cherry MX blues. I'll update this later on after using it more.
customer_reviews.author: Travis Morancie

customer_reviews.title: Love the keyboard, Hate the software
customer_reviews.text: First mechanical keyboard. I have always wanted one, now I will never go back to membrane. I Love it! Pros: -FPS key set is a nice addition. -lighting levels are good, can be very bright if you want them to. -Cherry mx red switches are a pleasure to use and are really responsive while gaming -Thick cable -Good value for money. Cons: -You really need a wrist rest with this. -The key caps seem narrower than my old keyboard, needs getting used to -Prone to accidental key presses. -That software is REALLY BAD! its extremely unintuitive and very hard to understand. Overall I am happy with that purchase and really enjoying it.
customer_reviews.author: Mostafa Mahmoud

customer_reviews.title: Solid Cherry MX Red keyboard, no frills aside from backlighting.
customer_reviews.text: There's nothing special about this mechanical keyboard and that's why I bought it. Cherry MX Red keys, sturdy build quality, backlight for gaming in the dark. For 80 dollars, it's good quality stuff. Be sure to clean it frequently so it'll last you for ages.
customer_reviews.author: Johnny

customer_reviews.title: Great Keyboard
customer_reviews.text: One minor complaint, the number keys have the numbers and symbols reversed. While not a deal breaker, it is annoying. Other than that works great, fairly quiet for a mechanical.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Amazing feel for the keys
customer_reviews.text: Plastic on aluminum, but they keys feel amazing and the lights look great. This was a great purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Jamaal Overton

customer_reviews.title: Great keyboard.
customer_reviews.text: This keyboard instantly increased my k/d ratio. I am now the Chuck Norris of keyboard warriors. They keys are responsive and the lights are programmable or u can turn them off. I love typing on this keybord. It makes trolling so pleasurable.
customer_reviews.author: H3H8M3

customer_reviews.title: Nice Gaming keyboard
customer_reviews.text: So in love with this keyboard, so much better then the one I had for 6 years. Adjustable colors, and when gaming you can set it up to the game. Its a wicked keyboard, I recommend it to any gamer.
customer_reviews.author: Zidda

customer_reviews.title: GREAT KEYBOARD SO FAR!
customer_reviews.text: clicking along, loving this keyboard! the only thing i don't like is that I cannot talk on the phone anymore while working at my desk because the peoople on the other end of the phone can tell that i'm ignoring them and working! (lol). been using for about 1 month so far.
customer_reviews.author: LINDA DEYARMOND

customer_reviews.title: Great keyboard!!!
customer_reviews.text: Son loves this and games all the time. It takes a beating on well and still works perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: jackie

customer_reviews.title: Solid Keyboard
customer_reviews.text: I had a corsair vengenace k70 and I really liked it but the aluminum base occasionally shocked me and some the keys tripple typed. I bought this keyboard as a replacement and I LOVE it. The keys feel amazing and aren't too loud. The lights are programmable and come with some good options.
customer_reviews.author: EMTDFJ

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: I bought this thing in October.. it is now February 3rd and it randomly stops working.. i need to plug & unplug for my pc to recognize it again.. I don’t give it 0 stars because I can’t..
customer_reviews.author: Joel A Rivera

customer_reviews.title: The performance is great. Keys need very little pressure
customer_reviews.text: The performance is great. Keys need very little pressure, are smooth and feel great. The only reason I cant give 5 stars is the keyboard has a tendency to slide a little. Its not constant but it does happen.
customer_reviews.author: the dude

customer_reviews.title: Plug directly into PC
customer_reviews.text: Plug directly into PC, not through a hub or your monitor. If you use don't plug it into the PC directly you can't change the settings on it.
customer_reviews.author: N8

customer_reviews.title: So responsive and feels wonderful
customer_reviews.text: I really, really like this thing. The keys are resposive and work effortlessly for typing and playing games like Overwatch. I just wish they came in blue, so now I've got a mixmatched blue desktop and redlit key board, haha. I'll update if any of the keys give me problems but everything came perfectly working~
customer_reviews.author: J.a.w.s

customer_reviews.title: Noisy but great
customer_reviews.text: It will take awhile to get used to it. Noisy (mechanical), but very responsive. Excellent weight. Doesn't move all over the place while gaming, (but I have an anti skid mat underneath it). I prefer not to have the lights on as it is distracting while gaming. Concentrating on the screen more than my keyboard. You can easily turn off the lights.
customer_reviews.author: M.C.

customer_reviews.title: Love it so far
customer_reviews.text: I just got this today and happy i bought it. I was using a logitechg710+ with brown switch. I am a hardcore csgo fan rank LE. While using logitech I felt like there were times I let go of the key and still moving. You will notice this if you play csgo cause when you're on the move and shoot bullet will go about 2000 inches away from the crosshair. I'm not sure the difference between brown and red but Im not experiencing this broblemwith crosshair strafe red. The size for me is just right and the feel of the key is great. I just wish all keyboard above $40 came with some wrist pads. I will update durability later
customer_reviews.author: mark

customer_reviews.title: Looks amazing, feels amazing, works amazing.
customer_reviews.text: Great, brightly colored LED's. Software is very customizable, although a little difficult to use at first. Build quality is great, and with the cherry mx red's, I enjoy typing a lot. Also, comes with wasd contoured keycaps, and comes with a set of mmo keycaps too.
customer_reviews.author: Philip M.

customer_reviews.title: I like it just fits my use perfectly for gaming and ...
customer_reviews.text: I like it just fits my use perfectly for gaming and typing. it looks like the letters, numbers, marks, symbols are illuminated under the caps, not like those printed on the caps that get fading over time. This kb is lighter than a typical mechanical kb that I have with SteelSeries and CM. The cable is almost as big as the cable of PSU. So far I like it. As mechanical kb it always makes noise when pressing the keys.
customer_reviews.author: Rookido

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Keyboard
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely Love this keyboard! Pros: *The cherry mx red switches have a nice clank to them but not so loud its annoying. *The effects are pretty cool * You can program macros so any key! Cons: * The text macros never stay the same they always get jumbled up *Cable is not braided but its still nice and thick and sturdy
customer_reviews.author: Sporadic Reviews

customer_reviews.title: Great Keyboard!
customer_reviews.text: Due to my job doing Medical Transcription, I go through keyboards at an alarming rate, about 2 per year. This one was suggested by a tech-savvy friend. It has a great feel when typing and the letters have not worn off because they are part of the keys, not a decal stuck on them! The light shining up from underneath is cool, too. Recommended!
customer_reviews.author: MLZ

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my son. He loves it. Complains about having to clean it but he is pretty sloppy. Constantly fuss about eating food at the same time and he is using it non stop daily.
customer_reviews.author: gustarddog

customer_reviews.title: I love this keyboard
customer_reviews.text: I love this keyboard. The Cherry Reds are fantastic. I use it for data entry at work. Not much else needs to be said. I do not regret buying this product. I did however put an o-ring on the 10-key "enter" button and "space bar" as I thought they were a little too loud but that could just be me.
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: Looks really good with the led lights
customer_reviews.text: Looks really good with the led lights. A bit "clunky" with the keys. Tends to be a bit too high when typing. Keys lettering is a bit too light and hard to see at night with medium to low lighting.
customer_reviews.author: Vulcan Nomad

customer_reviews.title: Amazing, strange key sounds
customer_reviews.text: This is a great keyboard, absolutely stunning LED effects with the software installed. The only thing I've noticed is a slight slight resistance and spring sound in several random keys, which is a bit noticeable when compared to how the keys are supposed to sound. I don't know why the specific keys creak, but it isn't a huge deal. This is a fantastic keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: Sav

customer_reviews.title: Great entry level mechanical keyboard with hidden bios mode
customer_reviews.text: Pretty sweet keyboard, I chose the one with Cherry MX Red switches. The red back light provides ample illumination in the dark. Note that the keyboard has a hidden bios mode for people wishing to tweak the system bios at boot time. You can activate said mode by holding down the F1 as well as the Windows lock button at the top right corner of the keyboard for about three seconds. The indicator for scroll lock will flash continuously once it is in bios mode. Similarly, you can turn the mode off by holding down the same buttons for three seconds.
customer_reviews.author: bastille77

customer_reviews.title: its low quality, high price...im stuck with it
customer_reviews.text: the keys ALWAYS pop off, and now the stupid little foot just broke, that props it up...
customer_reviews.author: amneziak

customer_reviews.title: Clacketty Clack, ... Don't Look Back.
customer_reviews.text: A friend of mine, in his sixties and dealing with macular degeneration, does AutoCad work, and recommended this gaming keyboard to me. Very attractive lighting, responsive, lots of 'travel' and has a feeling similar to the old Olivetti typewriter that I learned on. Much more preferable to the 'soft' travel and smaller keys of a typical wireless keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: M. Kruger

customer_reviews.title: Best Mechanical Keyboard that I have gotten so far
customer_reviews.text: Best Mechanical Keyboard that I have gotten so far, and also slightly cheaper. For relevance the two other mechanical keyboards I have used are the Sentey Mechanical Keyboard, and the Razer Blackwidow Tournament Edition Mechanical Keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas Youney

customer_reviews.title: Amazing keyboard. Arrived in great conditions and the feeling ...
customer_reviews.text: Just got the keyboard today, and I'm speechless. It's very nice and comfortable to write on it, I didn't even expected to be that nice. At the moment I'm even writing this review on my new Corsair Cherry keyboard, I totally love. I'm using this keyboard mainly for writing code, but for gaming also. This is the best keyboard for Gaming and Coding. For this price, the keyboard is really nice. I would totally recommend for people who want to play games like Counter Strike, World of Warcraft, League of Legends etc. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I have been using it for about a week now and it is fantastic. I primarily use it for FPS games and ...
customer_reviews.text: This was my first venture into the world of mechanical keyboards. I have been using it for about a week now and it is fantastic. I primarily use it for FPS games and it took a few rounds to get adjusted to it but now I can't imagine playing on any other keyboard. It seems durable and well built. There is a button on the keyboard to adjust the brightness of the back light. I was not aware of that when I bought it but once I found it made a huge difference being able to reduce the brightness so it was not overpowering.
customer_reviews.author: Kelsey P

customer_reviews.title: Decent MX Red KB
customer_reviews.text: Feels great, my only issue is that it seems to have a mind of its own. When the power goes out and back on, it lights up and doesn't respond to my Linux PC until I manually unplug the USB connectors and plug them back in. Also, the red LEDs really help with typing in the dark!
customer_reviews.author: Fellow Amazoner

customer_reviews.title: LOVEEEEE
customer_reviews.text: This is the best keyboard I've ever owned. The keys just feel so responsive to your touch. There is so much customization options with the color scheme, pattern, brightness, etc as well. IF you're a gamer, i cannot recommend this enough. It is everything that I wanted and was looking for in a gaming keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: Drew

customer_reviews.title: Beware, this keyboard will spoil you...
customer_reviews.text: OMG, what can I say, my first mechanical keyboard since that old IBM 104 key lead sled with the DIN plug died... Now I am spoiled, and it has made all the difference with sticky navigation keys in my gaming, as well as some pretty nifty things you can do with the software engine, if you are so inclined... Pretty red lights, and of course, the color scheme takes the Grammy, The Red and the Black.... The texture on the any key and the replaceable FPS/MOBA keys makes for quick and easy identification by touch, brilliant, and I love that stamped metal pattern...
customer_reviews.author: Moritz

product_meta.title: CORSAIR Strafe RGB MK.2 Mechanical Gaming Keyboard - USB Passthrough - Linear and Quiet - Cherry MX Red Switch - RGB LED Backlit
product_meta.description: Style:RGB BacklitThe next-generation CORSAIR STRAFE RGB MK.2 mechanical keyboard features 100% CHERRY MX RGB key switches with vibrant RGB backlighting, full-key-rollover anti-ghosting, and 8MB onboard profile storage to take your gaming profiles with you. The dedicated multimedia and volume controls allow you to adjust your audio without interrupting your game while the USB Pass-through port provides convenient access to plug in your devices. Powerful CORSAIR iCUE software enables sophisticated macro programming vivid dynamic multicolor illumination and full-system lighting synchronization. STRAFE RGB MK.2 comes fully loaded with a detachable soft-touch palm rest to provide optimal comfort and textured FPS/MOBA keycap sets. For use only with National Recognized Testing Laboratory listed end product and USB output rated 5Vdc, 900 mA.
feature_bullets: CHERRY MX RGB mechanical key switches with gold contacts deliver the ultimate performance and competitive advantage of mechanical keys
8MB Onboard profile storage with lighting and hardware macro playback to take your gaming profiles with you
Per-key RGB backlighting deliver dynamic and vibrant lighting effects with virtually unlimited customization
Dedicated multimedia and volume controls to adjust your audio without interrupting your game
USB pass-through port provides convenient access to an additional USB port for your mouse or headset
CORSAIR iCUE software enables vivid dynamic lighting control, sophisticated macro programming and full-system lighting synchronization across compatible CORSAIR peripherals, coolers, fans and more

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars1,036 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
